0.user_question: Mason needs 30 ounces of sugar to make a batch of suckers and 70 ounces of sugar to make a batch of fudge. How much sugar does he need to make 8931692 batches of suckers and 1 batch of fudge?

direct_answer.text: Let's think step by step. Mason needs 30 ounces of sugar to make a batch of suckers. 30 ounces x 1.5 = 45 ounces. So he needs to make 892 ounces of sugar. Mason has 10.5 pounds of sugar (10.5 x 1.5 = 15.25 ounces). He will use 1 pound of sugar to make 100 ounces of sugar. He needs to use 100 ounces of sugar to make 893, so he needs to use 9 x 100 ounces of sugar to make a batch of fudge (9 x 100 = 900 ounces). Therefore, he will use 1.5 x 900 ounces of sugar (1.5 x 900 = 1350 ounces) to make 8931692 batches of suckers. The answer is: 8931692.
